text: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the command of God our Savior and of Christ Jesus our hope,
speaker: Narrator

text:
To Timothy, my true child in the faith:
Grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: I urge you, as I did when I was on my way to Macedonia, to remain in Ephesus so that you may instruct certain people not to teach different teachings
speaker: Narrator

text: and not to occupy themselves with myths and endless genealogies that promote speculations rather than the divine training that is known by faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the aim of such instruction is love that comes from a pure heart, a good conscience, and sincere faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some people have deviated from these and turned to meaningless talk,
speaker: Narrator

text: desiring to be teachers of the law without understanding either what they are saying or the things about which they make assertions.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now we know that the law is good, if one uses it legitimately;
speaker: Narrator

text: this means understanding that the law is laid down not for the righteous but for the lawless and disobedient, for the godless and sinful, for the unholy and profane, for those who kill their father or mother, for murderers,
speaker: Narrator

text: the sexually immoral, men who engage in illicit sex, slave traders, liars, perjurers, and whatever else is contrary to the sound teaching
speaker: Narrator

text: that conforms to the glorious gospel of the blessed God, with which I was entrusted.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am grateful to Christ Jesus our Lord, who has strengthened me, because he considered me faithful and appointed me to his service,
speaker: Narrator

text: even though I was formerly a blasphemer, a persecutor, and a man of violence. But I received mercy because I had acted ignorantly in unbelief,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the grace of our Lord overflowed for me with the faith and love that are in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: The saying is sure and worthy of full acceptance: that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners—of whom I am the foremost.
speaker: Narrator

text: But for that very reason I received mercy, so that in me, as the foremost, Jesus Christ might display the utmost patience as an example to those who would come to believe in him for eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the King of the ages, immortal, invisible, the only God, be honor and glory forever and ever. Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: This charge I commit to you, Timothy, my child, in accordance with the prophecies made earlier about you, so that by following them you may fight the good fight,
speaker: Narrator

text: having faith and a good conscience. By rejecting conscience, certain persons have suffered shipwreck in the faith;
speaker: Narrator

text: among them are Hymenaeus and Alexander, whom I have turned over to Satan, so that they may be taught not to blaspheme.
speaker: Narrator

text: First of all, then, I urge that supplications, prayers, intercessions, and thanksgivings be made for everyone,
speaker: Narrator

text: for kings and all who are in high positions, so that we may lead a quiet and peaceable life in all godliness and dignity.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is right and acceptable before God our Savior,
speaker: Narrator

text: who desires everyone to be saved and to come to the knowledge of the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For
there is one God;
    there is also one mediator between God and humankind,
Christ Jesus, himself human,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who gave himself a ransom for all
—this was attested at the right time.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this I was appointed a herald and an apostle (I am telling the truth; I am not lying), a teacher of the gentiles in faith and truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I desire, then, that in every place the men should pray, lifting up holy hands without anger or argument,
speaker: Narrator

text: also that the women should dress themselves in moderate clothing with reverence and self-control, not with their hair braided or with gold, pearls, or expensive clothes,
speaker: Narrator

text: but with good works, as is proper for women who profess reverence for God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let a woman learn in silence with full submission.
speaker: Narrator

text: I do not permit a woman to teach or to have authority over a man; she is to keep silent.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Adam was formed first, then Eve,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Adam was not deceived, but the woman was deceived and became a transgressor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet she will be saved through childbearing, provided they continue in faith and love and holiness, with self-control.
speaker: Narrator

text: The saying is sure: whoever aspires to the office of bishop desires a noble task.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now a bishop must be above reproach, married only once, temperate, self-controlled, respectable, hospitable, an apt teacher,
speaker: Narrator

text: not a drunkard, not violent but gentle, not quarrelsome, and not a lover of money.
speaker: Narrator

text: He must manage his own household well, keeping his children submissive and respectful in every way,
speaker: Narrator

text: for if someone does not know how to manage his own household, how can he take care of God’s church?
speaker: Narrator

text: He must not be a recent convert, or he may be puffed up with conceit and fall into the condemnation of the devil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, he must be well thought of by outsiders, so that he may not fall into disgrace and the snare of the devil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deacons likewise must be serious, not double-tongued, not indulging in much wine, not greedy for money;
speaker: Narrator

text: they must hold fast to the mystery of the faith with a clear conscience.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let them first be tested; then, if they prove themselves blameless, let them serve as deacons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Women likewise must be serious, not slanderers, but temperate, faithful in all things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let deacons be married only once, and let them manage their children and their households well;
speaker: Narrator

text: for those who serve well as deacons gain a good standing for themselves and great boldness in the faith that is in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: I hope to come to you soon, but I am writing these instructions to you so that,
speaker: Narrator

text: if I am delayed, you may know how one ought to behave in the household of God, which is the church of the living God, the pillar and support of the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Without any doubt, the mystery of godliness is great:
He was revealed in flesh,
    vindicated in spirit,
        seen by angels,
proclaimed among gentiles,
    believed in throughout the world,
        taken up in glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Spirit expressly says that in later times some will renounce the faith by paying attention to deceitful spirits and teachings of demons,
speaker: Narrator

text: through the hypocrisy of liars whose consciences are seared with a hot iron.
speaker: Narrator

text: They forbid marriage and abstain from certain foods, which God created to be received with thanksgiving by those who believe and know the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For everything created by God is good, and nothing is to be rejected, provided it is received with thanksgiving,
speaker: Narrator

text: for it is sanctified by God’s word and by prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you put these instructions before the brothers and sisters, you will be a good servant of Christ Jesus, nourished on the words of the faith and of the sound teaching that you have followed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have nothing to do with profane and foolish tales. Train yourself in godliness,
speaker: Narrator

text: for, while physical training is of some value, godliness is valuable in every way, holding promise for both the present life and the life to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: The saying is sure and worthy of full acceptance.
speaker: Narrator

text: For to this end we toil and suffer reproach, because we have our hope set on the living God, who is the Savior of all people, especially of those who believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: Command and teach these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let no one despise your youth, but set the believers an example in speech and conduct, in love, in faith, in purity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Until I arrive, give attention to the public reading of scripture, to exhorting, to teaching.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not neglect the gift that is in you, which was given to you through prophecy with the laying on of hands by the council of elders.
speaker: Narrator

text: Put these things into practice, devote yourself to them, so that all may see your progress.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pay close attention to yourself and to your teaching; continue in these things, for in doing this you will save both yourself and your hearers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not speak harshly to an older man, but speak to him as to a father, to younger men as brothers,
speaker: Narrator

text: to older women as mothers, to younger women as sisters—with absolute purity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honor widows who are really widows.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a widow has children or grandchildren, they should first learn their religious duty to their own family and make some repayment to their parents, for this is pleasing in God’s sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: The real widow, left alone, has set her hope on God and continues in supplications and prayers night and day,
speaker: Narrator

text: but the widow who lives for pleasure is dead even while she lives.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give these commands as well, so that they may be above reproach.
speaker: Narrator

text: And whoever does not provide for relatives, and especially for family members, has denied the faith and is worse than an unbeliever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let a widow be put on the list if she is not less than sixty years old and has been married only once;
speaker: Narrator

text: she must be well attested for her good works, as one who has brought up children, shown hospitality, washed the saints’ feet, helped the afflicted, and devoted herself to doing good in every way.
speaker: Narrator

text: But refuse to put younger widows on the list, for when their sensual desires alienate them from Christ, they want to marry,
speaker: Narrator

text: and so they incur condemnation for having violated their first pledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: Besides that, they learn to be idle, gadding about from house to house, and they are not merely idle but also gossips and busybodies, saying what they should not say.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I would have younger widows marry, bear children, and manage their households, so as to give the adversary no occasion to revile us.
speaker: Narrator

text: For some have already turned away to follow Satan.
speaker: Narrator

text: If any believing woman has relatives who are widows, let her assist them; let the church not be burdened, so that it can assist those who are real widows.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the elders who rule well be considered worthy of double honor, especially those who labor in preaching and teaching,
speaker: Narrator

text: for the scripture says, “You shall not muzzle an ox while it is treading out the grain” and “The laborer deserves to be paid.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Never accept any accusation against an elder except on the evidence of two or three witnesses.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for those who persist in sin, rebuke them in the presence of all, so that the rest also may stand in fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the presence of God and of Christ Jesus and of the elect angels, I warn you to keep these instructions without prejudice, doing nothing on the basis of partiality.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not ordain anyone hastily, and do not participate in the sins of others; keep yourself pure.
speaker: Narrator

text: No longer drink only water, but take a little wine for the sake of your stomach and your frequent ailments.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sins of some people are conspicuous and precede them to judgment, while the sins of others follow them there.
speaker: Narrator

text: So also good works are conspicuous, and even when they are not, they cannot remain hidden.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let all who are under the yoke of slavery regard their masters as worthy of all honor, so that the name of God and the teaching may not be blasphemed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who have believing masters must not be disrespectful to them on the ground that they are brothers and sisters; rather, they must serve them all the more, since those who benefit by their service are believers and beloved.
Teach and urge these duties.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever teaches otherwise and does not agree with the sound words of our Lord Jesus Christ and the teaching that is in accordance with godliness
speaker: Narrator

text: is conceited, understanding nothing, and has a morbid craving for controversy and for disputes about words. From these come envy, dissension, slander, base suspicions,
speaker: Narrator

text: and wrangling among those who are depraved in mind and bereft of the truth, imagining that godliness is a means of gain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of course, there is great gain in godliness combined with contentment,
speaker: Narrator

text: for we brought nothing into the world, so that we can take nothing out of it,
speaker: Narrator

text: but if we have food and clothing, we will be content with these.
speaker: Narrator

text: But those who want to be rich fall into temptation and are trapped by many senseless and harmful desires that plunge people into ruin and destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the love of money is a root of all kinds of evil, and in their eagerness to be rich some have wandered away from the faith and pierced themselves with many pains.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for you, man of God, shun all this; pursue righteousness, godliness, faith, love, endurance, gentleness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fight the good fight of the faith; take hold of the eternal life to which you were called and for which you made the good confession in the presence of many witnesses.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the presence of God, who gives life to all things, and of Christ Jesus, who in his testimony before Pontius Pilate made the good confession, I charge you
speaker: Narrator

text: to keep the commandment without spot or blame until the manifestation of our Lord Jesus Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: which he will bring about at the right time—he who is the blessed and only Sovereign, the King of kings and Lord of lords.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is he alone who has immortality and dwells in unapproachable light, whom no one has ever seen or can see; to him be honor and eternal dominion. Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for those who in the present age are rich, command them not to be haughty or to set their hopes on the uncertainty of riches but rather on God, who richly provides us with everything for our enjoyment.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are to do good, to be rich in good works, generous, and ready to share,
speaker: Narrator

text: thus storing up for themselves the treasure of a good foundation for the future, so that they may take hold of the life that really is life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Timothy, guard the deposit entrusted to you. Avoid the profane chatter and contradictions of what is falsely called knowledge;
speaker: Narrator

text:
by professing it some have missed the mark as regards the faith.
Grace be with you.
speaker: Narrator
